name: Le Citizen Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel and stay there again - its in a great part of Paris and if you are staying a couple of nights you could do everything you wanted locally - lots of lovely bars and restaurants. Its walkable to the Marais and the centre of Paris, but far enough way from areas that are too busy or touristy.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Despite it being on a busy road and so many Parisians enjoying sitting out by the canal on Friday and Saturday night our road-facing room was perfectly quiet.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in a trendy area of Paris

reviews.text: Really lovely touches - the complimentary refreshments and mini bar and use of an iPad fully loaded with all the guidebooks and local amenities as well as interesting blogs, for the duration of your stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really friendly and helpful staff too!
reviews.title: Close, but just not carling...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 5th floor with our two kids (11 and 15 years old) and had two rooms connected, spacious, very clean with great view onto the Canal St Martin. Lovely cafes and restaurants around the canal, very friendly staff, and only 5 minutes walk to the place de la Republique and 5 more minutes to the marais. Highly recommended from the whole family.
reviews.title: Awesome Boutique Hotel in a Trendy Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fantastic hotel. good service. fantastic rooms. the room prices are not cheap but are in line with the average paris hotel fares. The hotel is in an excellent position . We were very impressed with this hotel, would stay here again and totally recommend it.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have recently spent 3 nights in Paris and, based on other TripAdvisor reviews, stayed at Le Citizen. We simply can't express in words how very much we enjoyed our stay and how comfortable we were made to feel - from the 'free minibar', the really friendly young staff (in particular Lore, Caroline & Erik), lovely breakfast and the clean spacious room - Le Citizen totally exceeded every expection we had.
reviews.title: A Gem

reviews.text: Le Citizen is close enough to central Paris to be convenient, but far enough away from the main tourist areas to be 'genuine Paris'.
reviews.title: Perfect Family Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only suggestion is to book Le Citizen well in advance, like we did. Once the word gets out about this gem of a boutique hotel, there are likely to be a lot of disappointed people who can't get in.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - in our top five
Incredible. Best base for the "new" Paris.
reviews.text: Michael & Zana

We stayed at Le Citizen for four nights at the end of June and it was wonderful-- I booked the hotel based on the reviews and we were very happy with the hotel. There were four of us so we stayed in a zen suite on the sixth floor. My daughters loved their beds that were nestled in the windows. The entire building is amazingly narrow, but the space is very well appointed. The hotel goes above and beyond many others and anticipates guests needs. There are even ear plugs in the room if one is bothered by the sounds outside at night! The staff are excellent and they are helpful and informative. We didn't use the mini-bar much, but it is such a nice thing that the drinks in it are free. My girls looked forward to the cookies or cakes that were provided in the room every afternoon.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located close to a metro stop. We often took the bus as we liked watching the sites on the way to our destinations.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to have dinner near the hotel, ask the staff and they will guide you to the right restaurant.
reviews.title: excellent!

reviews.text: I have been to Paris many times, but have never stayed on the canal in the past. It was truly a delightful place to stay and it great for families. It was a welcome place to return to for rest and relaxation.
reviews.title: exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: Can only echo the sentiments of everyone else, Le Citizen is great! Stayed for a very pleasant 3 nights. The staff are excellent, they all go out of their way to assist in any way they can. Really liked the location, the Canal really came alive at night. Definitely felt like we were off the main tourist trail. Free mini bar was great to have. The included breakfast was good and enough to set you up for a heavy day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Viva Le Citizen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five days here in mid-August 2013. We really liked the area, which is near Gare de L'Est and a little removed from the most tourist-heavy parts of town. The hotel staff pointed us to several good restaurants nearby, and were happy to try to make last-minute reservations for us. The breakfast was good, with a big window for when we could come down and remarkably friendly service. Our room - one of their smallest - was certainly small, but we knew that going in and got along just fine. We also really appreciated the snacks and drinks, which they refill in your room every day (things like a bottle of beer, cans of soda, a bottle of ice tea, a granola bar, etc.) and don't charge you for separately - though those obviously factor into the overall cost, it was nice not to feel nickled and dimed. And the Guest iPad, which they provide when you arrive and fill with lots of information on various Paris activities, was a nice touch as well. If the staff hadn't been so friendly and eager to make recommendations when asked, I imagine the iPad would have been enough to get us through the trip.
reviews.title: Great spot, great people
Excellent
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in transit to Spain mid August and the hotel was excellent. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. Stayed in a City L room on the second floor and were surprised at how spacious it was.
We are looking forward to another night at Le Citizen when we again transit on the way back to Australia.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.text: Had a fabulous weekend at Le Citizen with my family. Hotel is in a great location in a very cool neighborhood. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast is delicious as well.
reviews.title: Reviews are right - super funky and staff are super helpful.

description: A Boutique Hotel with twelve rooms run by a team whose ultimate goal is that guests enjoy every moment of their visit. The building has been completely renovated from top to bottom, with aesthetic natural wood accents throughout. The quality of the accommodations includes top of the line beds, flat screen television with a vast choice of international channels, air conditioning, sound buffering and complimentary in-room services of WiFi, filtered water...
